intro: Blandfordia maculata, commonly known as the spotted lily, is a striking flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in woodland and heathland environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is known for its fragrant blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. Blandfordia maculata is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and seasonal flowering.
